description: From de- +‎ phlogisticate, after French déphlogistiquer (“to dephlogisticate”).

verbs.description: dephlogisticate (third-person singular simple present dephlogisticates, present participle dephlogisticating, simple past and past participle dephlogisticated)

entries.meaning: To take away the phlogiston, i.e. ability to burn, which is now understood to be chemically impossible
